info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:24AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Gosper and northwestern Furnas Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1022 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking severe thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eustis to near Medicine Creek Reservoir State Recreation Area to 8 miles northwest of Indianola. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. These storms are still around least 30 minutes away from potentially impacting parts of Gosper and Furnas counties , and it is a bit unclear as to how intense they will have by the time they reach the area. However, if they do remain severe, a Severe Thunderstorm Warning may eventually be needed for parts of the area. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Arapahoe, Elwood and Holbrook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
